::Zardus::

"Even though those creatures could survive in space," Zardus 
says, "They wouldn't be the ideal alternate modes. Bots like the 
Warmachines, with vehicle alternate modes would easily outdo those 
beings in a space battle."

He leans forward. "However, we're not in space, and we can use those 
beings. I will provide you with time and resources to run your 
experiments, all I need is a good result."



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lady Hawk had to agree that her fathers ideas would be useless in 
space. "
> But isn't the ultimate challenge of every race to survive? To do so 
they
> must adapt." She hoped he'd follow her lead and complete her 
thoughts for
> her. As royalty she hadn't been prerared for such a debate. "I've 
seen many
> things in my time including creatures such as the ones you want me 
to create
> that can survive even without an atmosphere." she searched her 
memory banks
> for a quick example, "The voles of Tembre breathe the phosphorus 
gasses in
> thier atmosphere like we use the air as coolant for our internal 
circuitry."
> She knew he couldn't argue the example but he could push the issue. 
as much
> as she despised what she'd have to do she knew that it was her main 
chance
> at freedom. Even if it cost her her beliefs.\
